arm_group.arm_group_label: Oral polyethylene glycol (PEG) based preparation (9-12 years)
Oral polyethylene glycol (PEG) based preparation (13-16 years)

brief_summary.textblock:
To study the efficacy and safety of Prepopik™ in children aged 9 to 16 years for overall
      colon cleansing in preparation of colonoscopy

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Prepopik™ in Children for Overall Colon Cleansing in Preparation for Colonoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or female, aged 9 years to 16 years, inclusive, being scheduled to undergo
             elective colonoscopy

          -  Subjects must have had 3 or more spontaneous bowel movements per week for 1 month
             prior to the colonoscopy

          -  Female subjects of childbearing potential must undergo a pregnancy test at screening
             and again at randomization

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute surgical abdominal conditions (e.g., acute obstruction or perforation)

          -  Hospitalized  for inflammatory bowel disease

          -  Any prior colorectal surgery, excluding appendectomy, hemorrhoid surgery, or prior
             endoscopic surgical procedures

          -  Colon disease (history of colonic cancer, toxic megacolon, toxic colitis, idiopathic
             pseudo obstruction, hypomotility syndrome, colon resection)

          -  Ascites

          -  Gastrointestinal disorder (active ulcer, outlet obstruction, retention,
             gastroparesis, ileus)

          -  Upper gastrointestinal surgery (gastric resection, gastric banding, gastric bypass)

          -  Significant cardiovascular disease as determined by the investigator

          -  If subject has a history of renal insufficiency, serum creatinine and potassium must
             be within normal limits

          -  Any clinically significant laboratory value at screening, including pre- existing
             electrolyte abnormality, based on clinical history

          -  Hypersensitivity to active ingredients

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Assessor-Blind, Multicenter, Dose-Ranging Study Comparing the Safety and Efficacy of Prepopik™ Versus Polyethylene Glycol Preparation (Local Standard of Care) in Children Aged 9 Years to 16 Years

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects defined by "excellent" or "good" in the Aronchick Scale

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of abnormal findings in laboratory tests
Incidence of abnormal findings in physical exams
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From up to 21 days prior to colonoscopy and at the day of colonoscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects who took the assigned dose for colon cleansing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: approx. 1 day  (From the day before colonoscopy to the day of colonoscopy)

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of each category of the "Subject's Tolerability and Satisfaction Questionaire"

secondary_outcome.description: For PK sampling 5 subjects per treatment group will be assessed
secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) assessment: Cmax (maximum concentration of drug in the blood)

secondary_outcome.description: For PK sampling 5 subjects per treatment group will be assessed
secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: Tmax (time when maximum concentration of drug in the blood is achieved)

secondary_outcome.description: For PK sampling approximately 5 subjects per treatment group will be assessed
secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: AUC (area under the curve correlates with the total amount of drug exposure in the blood)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
